message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is about comparing the performance of neural and phrase-based approaches in Statistical Machine Translation (SMT), which falls under the category of Natural Language Processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers NLP and related topics. The paper also involves the use of neural networks, which suggests that it could be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper involves analyzing the outputs of SMT systems, which could be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
